abstract: Many children pick up an iPad and figure out how to use it right away. One Laptop Per Child, a nonprofit organization that produces low-cost computers, wants to provide tablets to poor children as well.
lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS -- Many children pick up an iPad and figure out how to use it right away - swiping and poking the screen in a way that just seems to come naturally to them. One Laptop Per Child, a nonprofit organization that produces low-cost computers for developing countries, wants to take the tablet experience to poor children as well. It showcased its XO 3.0 tablet at the International Consumer Electronics Show this week.

headline.main: Are Tablets Expensive Toys? Not This One
